message.content:
cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CY 

This paper is primarily focused on personalized article recommendation on news sites, which is a common problem in information retrieval (IR). Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper also deals with mitigating data sparsity, which is a common challenge in machine learning and data mining, making cs.SI (social and information networks) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also proposes a novel variant of factor models, which are commonly used in machine learning and statistics, making cs.LG (machine learning) a likely sub-category. The paper also deals with natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as text classification and topic modeling, making cs.CL (computation and language) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with online news sites, which are a common application of web science, making cs.CY (computers and society) a possible sub-category.
